alert.note: Alert for Elko (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 20 at 4:46AM PDT until further notice by NWS Elko
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Nevada... Humboldt River At Comus affecting Humboldt County. .Warm temperatures will melt snowpack and keep river levels elevated. For the Lower Humboldt...including Palisade, Battle Mountain, Comus...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING FOR SNOWMELT NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring with levels dropping to action stage forecast likely later this morning. A return to minor flood stage is forecast for Wednesday. * WHERE...Humboldt River At Comus. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 9.5 feet, Minor Flood Stage. Minor lowland flooding throughout the reach. No flooding in Winnemucca. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 4:15 AM PDT Saturday the stage was 9.6 feet. - Recent Activity...The maximum river stage in the 24 hours ending at 4:15 AM PDT Saturday was 10.0 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise above flood stage early Wednesday morning and continue rising to 9.5 feet early Wednesday morning. Additional rises are possible thereafter. - Flood stage is 9.5 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 9.5 feet on 06/13/1999. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Motorists should not attempt to drive around barricades or drive cars through flooded areas. Please report observed flooding to local emergency services or law enforcement and request they pass this information to the National Weather Service when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued this afternoon at 100 PM PDT.
